intro: Ophthalmophyllum haramoepense, commonly known as the Karoo starflower, is a perennial herb native to the semi-arid regions of South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, which is characterized by succulent leaves and showy flowers. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white, blooming in spring. It thrives in well-drained sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid conditions. Ophthalmophyllum haramoepense is often found in open grasslands and along rocky outcrops.
